intro: Coccoloba nematostachya, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed coral tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it typically grows in coastal areas and disturbed soils. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that appear in clusters. It is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions. The species is also valued for its ability to stabilize soil and prevent erosion in coastal environments.
